Until 30th September 2013 a pilot of revised counter opening times will run. The court counter will be open to the public between 10am and 2pm on every day the courthouse itself is open. Urgent work will always be dealt with (including outside the counter times) but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of work.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

A free Small Claims Mediation Service is available. Please telephone the mediation service or email for more details.

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

info:
Until 30th September 2013 the counter will run an appointments only pilot and the counter will be closed. Urgent work will always receive an appointment but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of work.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS2

This court offers a free Small Claims Mediation Service (subject to judicial approval) for customers involved in Small Claims Proceedings under £5,000. For further information see the Mediation Service telephone and fax numbers listed within contacts or email for more details.

This court also supports the National Mediation Scheme for claims above £5,000. To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/ .

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

info:
Until 30th September 2013 a pilot of revised counter opening times will run. The court counter will be open to the public between 10am and 2pm on every day the courthouse itself is open. Urgent work will always be dealt with (including outside the counter times) but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of work.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

This court offers a free Small Claims Mediation Service (subject to judicial approval) for customers involved in Small Claims Proceedings under £5,000. For further information see the Mediation Service telephone and fax numbers listed within Contacts or email the Mediation Support Officer.

This court also supports the National Mediation Scheme for claims above £5,000. To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/.

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

info:
Until 30th September 2013 a pilot of revised county court counter opening times will run. The county court counter will be open to the public between 10am and 2pm on every day the courthouse itself is open. Urgent county court work will always be dealt with (including outside the counter times) but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of county court work. This pilot does not apply to the High Court and Administrative Court - these counters will remain open from 10am until 4pm.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre (CCMCC).

info:
Help and Advice: Payment can be made by telephone Monday to Friday 9:00am till 4:00pm. If sending cash payment by post we recommend that you do so by way of recorded delivery. If you require your licence to be returned by recorded delivery, please enclose a pre-paid, self-addressed recorded delivery envelope, alternatively if you require your licence to be returned urgently please inform us of this and enclose a self addressed, pre-paid next day guaranteed envelope. All licences returned via Royal Mail, 2nd Class post.

Please note: for travel directions using sat-nav, please use postcode PL1 2ER.

The Personal Support Unit supports members of the public attending Wandsworth County Court. The PSU gives practical, emotional and procedural help. If visiting the court, ask for the PSU at the front desk. Please note that the PSU is independent of the court, and so is unable to give help on specific cases or transfer your calls to the court office. Telephone and Email details are listed below.

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

info:
From 03rd June 2013 the High Wycombe County Court building will be open again. 

Until 25th July 2013 all High Wycombe case hearings will continue to take place at Slough County Court, after that they will revert back to High Wycombe County Court venue.

A Drop Box facility is available to customers to submit applications of non urgent work. All post to be addressed to Slough County Court Windsor Road, Slough, Berkshire SL1 2HE

Until 30th September 2013 the counter will run an appointments only pilot and the counter will be closed. Urgent work will always receive an appointment but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of work.

Affidavit service will be by appointment only, please ring 01753 690300 to make a High Wycombe County Court appointment. For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

A free small claims mediation service (subject to suitability) is accessible for customers involved in small claims proceedings. Please telephone the mediation service or email the Mediation Support Officer for further details.

HMCTS is also a supporter of the National Mediation scheme (for Fast and Multi track cases). To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/  . For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

This court has a judicial led conciliation scheme, to which all local cases (bar Road Traffic Act cases) are likely to be referred.

This court offers a free Small Claims Mediation Service (subject to judicial approval) for customers involved in Small Claims Proceedings under £5,000. For further information see the Mediation Service telephone and fax numbers listed within Contacts or email the Mediation Support Officer.

This court also supports the National Mediation Scheme for claims above £5,000. To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/.

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

This court offers a free Small Claims Mediation Service (subject to judicial approval) for customers involved in Small Claims Proceedings under £5,000. For further information see the Mediation Service telephone and fax numbers listed within Contacts or email for more details.

This court also supports the National Mediation Scheme for claims above £5,000. To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/.

Please telephone Civil/Enforcement appointments - 01983 535100 ext 218, Family appointments - 01983 535100 ext 211 for an appointment.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS2

This court offers a free Small Claims Mediation Service (subject to judicial approval) for customers involved in Small Claims Proceedings under £5,000. For further information telephone the Mediation Service or email . This court also supports the National Mediation Scheme for claims above £5,000. To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/ .

info:
Until 30th September 2013 a pilot of revised county court counter opening times will run. The county court counter will be open to the public between 10am and 2pm on every day the courthouse itself is open. Urgent county court work will always be dealt with (including outside the counter times) but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of county court work. This pilot does not apply to the High Court and Administrative Court - these counters will remain open from 10am until 4pm.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

The Personal Support Unit supports members of the public attending Manchester Civil Justice Centre. The PSU gives practical, emotional and procedural help. If visiting the court, ask for the PSU at the front desk. Please note that the PSU is an independent organisation and so is unable to give help on specific cases or transfer your calls to the court office. Please contact the PSU via the contact details below.

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

info:
Until 30th September 2013 a pilot of revised county court counter opening times will run. The county court counter will be open to the public between 10am and 2pm on every day the courthouse itself is open. Urgent county court work will always be dealt with (including outside the counter times) but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of county court work. This pilot does not apply to the High Court and Administrative Court - these counters will remain open from 10am until 4pm.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1 

From 5 November 2012, the Civil Justice Centre will also hold Adminstrative Court hearings

Please note: Due to the high volumes of calls being received, court users are encouraged to telephone the court in “non peak” hours which are 11am-12pm and 3pm-5pm.

This court offers a free Small Claims Mediation Service (subject to judicial approval) for customers involved in Small Claims Proceedings under £5,000. For further information see the Mediation Service telephone and fax numbers listed within Contacts or email the Mediation Support Officer.
This court also supports the National Mediation Scheme for claims above £5,000. To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/ .

http://www.bristol.gov.uk/ccm/navigation/transport-and-streets provides details on all public transport in and around Bristol City Centre.

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

Customers can obtain information on Bristol Chancery User guidance by e-mailing the chancery clerk - BristolChancerylisting@hmcts.gsi.gov.uk
name: Bristol Civil Justice Centre

info:
A modern civic structure with 16 000 square metres of purpose built space.

Parties choosing English law to govern their transactions can agree to bring disputes before courts in the Rolls Building from anywhere in the world.

Established and advanced case management techniques and cost control mechanisms help ensure the prompt and more economic disposal of cases, without compromising thoroughness or the use of expertise.

The building is situated within 30 minutes of many of the world’s prominent law firms and chambers.

The Rolls Building is accessible internationally via London City, London Heathrow, London Gatwick and London Stansted airports
name: Rolls Building

info:
Until 30th September 2013 a pilot of revised counter opening times will run. The court counter will be open to the public between 10am and 2pm on every day the courthouse itself is open. Urgent work will always be dealt with (including outside the counter times) but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of work.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre (CCMCC).

info:
The London 2012 Olympic & Paralympic Games will impact on local  public transport and road networks. Court users are asked to make only essential trips to visit court offices. 

Please consider your choice of transport. Many car parks will be controlled by Olympic planners and it is highly unlikely that parking will be available at the court. 

From  Monday 30th July to Friday 10th August this court will open between 8.00am and 5.00pm. Court sittings will be brought forward one hour and commence at 9.00 am. 

For information about Olympic activities in the Weymouth area please visit  http://www.dorsetforyou.com/sailing2012

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

A free Small Claims Mediation Service is available after issue. Please telephone or email for further details.

To pay a fine please call the 24-hour Debit and Credit Card Payment Line. Please have your fine account number and division number ready.

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.

Urgent county court work will always be dealt with (including outside the counter times) but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of county court work. This pilot does not apply to the High Court and Administrative Court - these counters will remain open from 10am until 4pm.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre (CCMCC).

info:
Until 30th September 2013 a pilot of revised county court counter opening times will run. The county court counter will be open to the public between 10am and 2pm on every day the courthouse itself is open. Urgent county court work will always be dealt with (including outside the counter times) but users may be directed to alternative methods of communication for certain types of county court work. This pilot does not apply to the High Court and Administrative Court - these counters will remain open from 10am until 4pm.

For more details see http://www.justice.gov.uk/courts/county-court-counter-opening-hours

If you would like to provide feedback on the pilot you can complete our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/HMCTS1

A free Small Claims Mediation Service is available to parties with a current defended claim. Please telephone the mediation service or email for further information.

The Personal Support Unit supports members of the public attending Cardiff Civil Justice Centre and provides non-legal support offering practical, emotional and procedural help to all court users. Please note that the PSU is an independent organisation and so is unable to give help on specific cases or transfer your calls to the court office. Please contact the PSU via the contact details below.

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre (CCMCC).

Please note: when contacting the helpdesk by telephone or email, please quote your case number and the name of the court where your case is being heard.

A free Small Claims Mediation Service (subject to suitability) is accessible for customers involved in small claims proceedings. Please telephone the mediation service or email the Mediation Support Officer for further details.

HMCTS is also a supporter of the National Mediation scheme (for Fast and Multi track cases). To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/ .

For all enquiries relating to Designated Money Claims, please contact the County Court Money Claims Centre.
